K-Hole page = random things (enter at the risk of your productivity...)
posted on January 20, 2016

As in every office, we occasionally send links around. Sometimes those links end up on this page – there’s no rhyme or reason why they do or don’t, really… Anyway, you’re about to waste a fair bit of time if you seriously scroll down. Enjoy!

  • Test your brain smarts at this brain quiz: http://www.purposegames.com/game/brain-anatomy-quiz. There are other geography games on that site that are also interesting.
  • Whose views most mirror yours? http://www.isidewith.com might be interesting to you…
  • Mariano Rivera — bimodal pitching
  • The WEIRD Bias
  • 300 actions-per-minute in Starcraft
  • Double Vision: Parsing Images That Trick Our Brain
  • 3min documentary on infant motor learning and rehab
  • Quantum Pseudo-Telepathy in game theory
  • Scratch-Input
  • David Mackay’s new book on energy consumption is also available for Free! online
  • Banjo used in brain surgery
  • List of animals by number of neurons
  • PDF Stock Market Behavior Predicted by Rat Neurons. TC Marzullo, EG Rantze, and GJ Gage. Annals of Improbable Research (2006). Synergies, Bah: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5GNzBFnUAdo
  • Putt Probabilities
  • Bio-motion Demo
  • Two-envelope paradox
  • Monty Hall problem applied to psychology
  • Context-Free Grammar for Generating Papers
  • High Dynamic Range Pictures
  • Wii-Projects
  • Collective attention (using data from digg)
  • Que? : http://scienceblogs.com/cognitivedaily/2007/10/can_you_use_the_force_to_find.php
  • Here’s a cool visual illusion
  • from some random guy at UCL: http://www.cs.ucl.ac.uk/staff/d.quercia/
  • Savant-like numerosity skills revealed in normal people by magnetic pulses. Snyder, A. and Bahramali, H. and Hawker, T. and Mitchell. Perception (2006).

Learn Something

  • Watch Konrad give a lecture.
  • Scholarpedia - Encyclopedia of Computational Neuroscience
  • Scholarpedia - Encyclopedia of Computational Intelligence (Stats and ML) Computational Neuroscience on the World Wide Web
  • Andrew Moore’s Tutorials on ML and Data Mining
  • Robbie Jacob’s Cheat Sheets
  • Tom Griffith’s Bayesian Reading List
  • Liam Paninski’s Statistical Analysis of Neural Data course page
  • Zoubin Ghahramani’s Unsupervised Learning course page
  • Tom Minka’s Statistical Learning/Pattern Recognition Glossary

Books

  • MacKay - Information Theory, Inference, and Learning Algorithms
  • Bishop - Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning
  • Dayan and Abbott - Theoretical Neuroscience
  • Gerstner and Kistler - Spiking Neuron Models

Blogs

  • Radford Neal’s Blog
  • Andrew Gelman’s Blog - Statistical Modeling, Causal Inference, and Social Science
  • John Langford’s Blog - Machine Learning Theory
  • NLPers - Natural Language Processing Blog
  • MindHacks - Neuroscience Blog

Software (for Matlab)

  • CVX - convex programming
  • fastICA
  • Isomap - nonlinear dimensionality reduction
  • Iain Murray’s Matlab tips and tricks

Datasets

  • Sam Roweis’ Datasets - MNIST, faces, and text
  • CHILDES - transcripts and media from children
  • TalkBank - transcripts and media from adults
  • UCI - ML repository
  • Wikipedia - Classic Datasets

Rand

  • Classic Papers in Vision
